derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from Latin communicat- 'shared', from the verb communicare, from communis (see common)

entry.def: If you communicate with someone, you share or exchange information with them, for example by speaking, writing, or using equipment. You can also say that two people communicate .

example.ex: My natural mother has never communicated with me...
example.tran: 我的亲生母亲从未和我联系过。

example.ex: Officials of the CIA depend heavily on electronic mail to communicate with each other...
example.tran: 中情局官员之间的联系在很大程度上依赖电子邮件。

entry.def: If you communicate information, a feeling, or an idea to someone, you let them know about it.

example.ex: They successfully communicate their knowledge to others...
example.tran: 他们成功地把知识传授给他人。

example.ex: The results will be communicated to parents...

entry.def: If one person communicates with another, they successfully make each other aware of their feelings and ideas. You can also say that two people communicate .

example.ex: He was never good at communicating with the players...
example.tran: 他不善于和队员们进行沟通。

example.ex: Family therapy showed us how to communicate with each other.
example.tran: 家庭疗法指导我们彼此之间的沟通交流。

sentences.sentence: "Please communicate this message to all employees"
"He communicated his anxieties to the psychiatrist"
